title: OSVR Device description file
description: This schema documents and guides creation of a device description file, that both describes the interfaces available, and provides semantic mappings to those interfaces.

aliasGrouping.title: Grouping for semantic aliases
aliasGrouping.description: A 'directory' on the semantic tree. May also contain an alias at its own level, described by '$target'

author.title: Descriptor author name and email address

lastModified.title: Descriptor Last-Modified timestamp
lastModified.description: Should use RFC 3339, section 5.6 format, aka javascript (new Date()).toJSON()

tracker.title: Tracker interface description
tracker.description: Describes properties of the tracker interface provided by this device.

count.title: Number of sensors
count.description: number of tracker sensors, if bounded and known

bounded.title: Sensor count bounded?
bounded.description: true if the IDs of sensors reporting are bounded (usually known ahead of time) or false if they are unbounded (new ID for each item tracked, for instance)

analog.title: Analog interface description
analog.description: Describes properties of the analog interface provided by this device.

traits.title: Per-channel traits
traits.description: Entries in this array are mapped directly to analog channels - entry 0 describes channel 0, etc. Thus, if you want to describe channel n, you must describe channel n-1 (at least trivially with an empty object) down to 0.

items.title: Analog Channel Traits
items.description: Describes relevant properties of the analog data reported on this channel. In the case of a joystick, the 'rest' will likely be halfway between 'min' and 'max', while an analog button will likely have 'min' equal to 'rest'. These parameters may be used for scaling the data as requested by a client application or analysis module.

button.title: Button interface description
button.description: Describes properties of the button interface provided by this device.
